Everyone:

I'm looking for a couple of good examples of legacy code that re=
quires private access to test. Notably:

* A class that must provide access=
 to private data in order to test a public method
* A class that merits tes=
ting a private method

I don't need code. I am interested in a description =
of a class that fits either requirement. If you'd like to offer an example,=
 I'd appreciate it.

I thought about a Money example, but ran into a roadbl=
ock. Here is what I had.

Money {
    private data
    private constructor
=
    creation method

    add(dollars) {
        increment dollars;
    }
}
=

Here in order to test add() you must look at the private data, because equ=
als() is not implemented. The problem with this example is that there is no=
 way to actually use this class!

Thanks for your help.


J. B. Rainsberger=
